original: Karlson, Ernst Gustaf Ragnar, redaktör, Vimmerby, f. 2S/^/9A i Made-sjö, Kalmar L, av Johan Viktor K. o. Johanna Karlson. G. 26 m. Elisabeth Johansson. — Stud. v. folkhögsk. Jour-mdist sted. 16, red:. ,f. National-Ku-riren 18-20, red. f. Vimmerby Posten. Led. av stadsfullm. sed. 35, kyrkofullm. sed. 33, folksk :styr. sed. 36, beredn:-utsk. sed. 37, nykterh :nd sed. 29, ordf. sed. 3S, led; av stadsbibi:styr. 2:9-39, orldf. 311-39, sefkr. i Sevedebygds forn-minnes- o. hembygdsfören. sed. 26, sekr: i folkpart. lokalavd., led. av Kalmar 1. arb :utsk. av folkpart. sed. 34, suppl. i folkpart. förtr :råd sed. 44, v. ordf. i poldsndn ’sed. 43, v. ordf. o. sekr. i civ :försv:ndn sed. 44, led. av ’Styr. f. Kalmar 1. nykterh :förb. 36-37 isamt sed. 43, ordf. sed. 45, omb :man i läns-nykterh :ndn ’sed. 39, v. ordf. i Kalmar 1. distr. av Nykterh mämndernas riks-förb. ’Sed. 38, innehaft ett flert. styr:- 0. förtr :uppdr. inom nykterh :rör. o. folkpart. i Nybro, Kalmar, Örebro, Sunne, Vimmerby. Medl. av folkpart., NTO, TR, Sv. vänsterpressfören.
translated: Karlson, Ernst Gustaf Ragnar, editor, Vimmerby, b. 2S/^/9A in Made-sjö, Kalmar County, son of Johan Viktor K. and Johanna Karlson. Married on the 26th of [unknown month] to Elisabeth Johansson. - Attended a folk high school. Worked as a journalist from 1916, editor of the National-Kuriren from 1918 to 1920, and editor of the Vimmerby Posten. Member of the municipal council since 1935, member of the church council since 1933, member of the school board since 1936, member of the committee since 1937, member of the temperance society since 1929, president since 1938, member of the library board from 1929 to 1939, president from 1931 to 1939, secretary of the Sevedebygds Antiquarian and Historical Society since 1926, secretary of the local branch of the Liberal Party, member of the Kalmar 1st labor committee of the Liberal Party since 1934, substitute member of the executive council of the Liberal Party since 1944, vice president of the national board since 1943, vice president and secretary of the civil defense council since 1944, member of the board of the Kalmar 1st temperance association from 1936 to 1937 and also since 1943, president since 1945, representative in the county temperance board since 1939, vice president of the Kalmar 1st district of the national temperance associations since 1938, and held several positions within the temperance movement and the Liberal Party in Nybro, Kalmar, Örebro, Sunne, and Vimmerby. Member of the Liberal Party, NTO (The Swedish Total Abstinence Society), TR (Temperance Society in Sweden), and the Swedish Left Press Association.
